description: Conversion of single storey rear storage area associated with retail unit (use class A1) to self-contained flat (use class C3), together with alterations including rooflights, new window in side elevation, closing up of existing side elevation opening, cycle storage and refuse storage.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: 0612/DB/01A (Site Location Plan), 0612/DB/02A (Existing Ground Floor Plan/Existing North Elevation), 0612/DB/03B (Proposed Ground Floor Plan/Proposed North Elevation), 0612/DB/04B (Existing Front Elevation, Existing & Proposed Rear Elevations), 0612/DB/05A (Existing/Proposed South Elevation), 0612/DB/06B (Plan of Studio Flat), 0612/DB/07A (Refuse & Recycle Store Details), Cycle Store Details (No Ref)unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1, and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), policies 1.1, 1.2 and 4.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 3.5, LV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policies 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | The studio flat hereby approved shall be constructed to the Lifetime Homes Standards, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development is accessible by all future occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 (Accessible Ealing),  policies 1.1, 1.2 and 4.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 3.5, LV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013)  and policy 7.2 of the London Plan (2011). | Details of sound attenuation measures from external noise together with ventilation for the proposed studio flat shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. The development shall thereafter be implemented only in accordance with the approved details, which shall be retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 10 (Noise and Vibration), policy 7A of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2011). | The cycle parking facilities shown on the approved plans shall be provided on the site prior to the first occupation of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason:  To provide adequate facilities for cyclists in accordance with the policy 9.1 of the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1, 1.2 & 4.1 of the Ealing Council Core Strategy (2012), policy LV 3.5 of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2011). | The refuse and recycling storage facilities shown on the approved plans shall be provided on the site prior to the first occupation of the development. As a part of this provision the proposed new doorway to the refuse store adacent to the common right of way with no. 107 Greenford Road shall be fitted and permanently maintained with a sliding door (which shall not open out over the shared alleyway) and which shall be permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, and to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area.in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1, and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 (Refuse Storage), policies 1.1, 1.2 and 4.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 3.5, LV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policies 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | A refuse management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details as approved shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development hereby permitted and retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, and to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area.in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1, and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 (Refuse Storage), policies 1.1, 1.2 and 4.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 3.5, LV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policies 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | The development hereby authorised shall comply with 'The aims and objectives of the Police requirements of Secured By Design.'  Reason: In the interests of crime prevention and the safety and security of the site, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.4 and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Guidance 8 (Safer Ealing),  policies 1.1, 1.2 and 4.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy LV 7.3 of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policy 7.3 of the London Plan (2011). | Notwithstanding the provisions of section 55 of the Town and Country Planning Act (1990 as amended), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted, without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.  Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 4.1, and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), policies 1.1, 1.2 and 4.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 3.5, LV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policies 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | No development shall commence until details of the proposed underground services including drainage and utilities infrastructure for the proposed studio flat has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details as approved shall be implemented on the site only in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that adequate drainage and utilities infrastructure is provided to the proposed studio flat in accordance with policy 3.5, of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policy 3.5 of the London Plan (2011).
